class_notes: This course analyzes major social problems in modern society, their nature, how they develop, and their causes. We'll examine the impact of several problems such as poverty, crime, alcoholism, substance abuse, and prejudice on the individual and societal levels. After completing the course, you should be able to: 1) demonstrate a sociological understanding of various social problems; 2) analyze what factors define and label social problems; and 3) critically evaluate how social movement activity contributes to the causes and remedies of social problems.
course_description: Social and cultural conditions of stress and tension in a changing society. Evaluation of efforts to solve social problems.
